title: How to Clone Ethereum & What Ethereum Offers
author: marsresident / Van Kush Family
overview: Complete guide to cloning Ethereum - easier than creating a Cryptonote. Two-part guide covering genesis block generation, network setup, and dApps development for beginners who can copy/paste into Linux command line

key_insight.discovery: It is actually easier to create an Ethereum Fork than it is to create a CryptoNote
key_insight.prerequisite: Can clone Ethereum using Linux even with no prior cryptocurrency experience
key_insight.skill_needed: Only need to copy and paste into Linux command line

part1_installation.bleeding_edge: Install ethereum-unstable package instead for latest

bootnode_setup.purpose: Get your Public URL for everyone to connect

consensus_method.process: Put your Genesis.json file into Ethereum Wallet
consensus_method.result: Turns old Wallet into a Wallet for your new Blockchain

dapps_explained.definition: Decentralized Apps - apps that run on blockchain
dapps_explained.significance: Most people miss this part in the world of Bitcoin, Ethereum, and ICOs
dapps_explained.what_you_create: Clone of what Ethereum offers, but on a NEW Network

smart_contracts.description: Contracts that work like currencies but have underlying operations
examples: Animals that can be bred and traded (CryptoKitties)
Fuel for game actions that can be lost/gained between players
Exchanges for trading Smart Contract tokens

cryptokitties.description: Ethereum app for breeding and trading digital cats
cryptokitties.impact: Showed mainstream potential of blockchain apps

famous_dapps.etherdelta: Exchange on Ethereum for trading Smart Contract Tokens

quiz_questions.q: Why is Ethereum cloning easier than Cryptonote according to @marsresident?
quiz_questions.a: The process is more straightforward - can be done by anyone who can copy/paste into Linux command line
quiz_questions.explanation: Two-part guide covers everything from installation to dApps

quiz_questions.q: What is the purpose of the Genesis.json file?
quiz_questions.a: Defines the initial state of your blockchain - putting it in Ethereum Wallet turns it into a wallet for your new chain
quiz_questions.explanation: Contains chainId, difficulty, gasLimit, and initial account allocations

quiz_questions.a: Decentralized Apps - applications that run on blockchain, not controlled by single entity
quiz_questions.explanation: Smart contracts enable breeding games, exchanges, and more

quiz_questions.a: Development framework for Ethereum - helps build, test, and deploy smart contracts
quiz_questions.explanation: Used with Ganache for local blockchain testing

quiz_questions.a: Showed mainstream potential of blockchain apps - collectible cats that can be bred and traded
quiz_questions.explanation: Demonstrated smart contracts could create engaging user experiences
